Okay well i want to put in some new texture packs but every time i add one and i go to the title screen and click "Mods and texture packs" it just gives me a blank screen. what do i do. (game works 100% perfectly btw except for those parts) and also if i add new mods the same thing happens except i cant go to the title screen and have to re-download it. Please help
Also can i play online, if so then how?
nvm found out that with some texture packs it will give a blank screen but i fixed it. However how do i play multiplayer?

@TheMadHat hey great you found the texturing stuff out yourself... if you want to play online you could use hamachi, tough I don't understand hamachi at all... there are 100000+ vids on youtube for that =) and if you find a cracked server you can just fill in the IP and you can play online, simple as that

@TheMadHat and when adding new mods you should be careful, some mods can't be installed at the same time otherwise minecraft will crash. if this isn't your problem it could be that minecraft is using an older version of java which some mods don't support... good luck, if there are any problems I answer as soon as possible

@DeathOfJack hey very simple.... 
1.just go to HOME/library/application support/minecraft and drag your saves out (to desktop) 
2.then drag the downloaded "minecraft" folder into HOME/library/applications support 
3.drag your saves back in (same place as #1)
4.drag the app (the minecraft logo with the title "minecraftsp" to your programs 
5.it should work
do you still need to install the mods?

yes and no.... you just have to drag the minecraft folder into home/library/applications support and drag the program "minecraftsp" into your programs if you don't know what you're doing ignore the rest

though you fist should drag out your saves....

(HOME/library/application support/minecraft)

Hey, 5 steps....

1) drag out your saves.... (can be found by going to: HOME/library/application support/minecraft)

2) delete the minecraft folder (where you just dragged your saves out)

3) replace the folder with the "minecraft" folder you downloaded from me (so place the folder at HOME/library/application support)

4) place "minecraftSP" inside your applications

5) see if its working and leave the rest, if you don't know what you're doing ;]
